title: Dada's New Journey Begins - Sourav Ganguly Takes Charge As The 39th President Of The BCCI
text:
Dada's New Journey Begins - Sourav Ganguly Takes Charge As The 39th President Of The BCCI

Dada's New Journey Begins - Sourav Ganguly Takes Charge As The 39th President Of The BCCI

Sourav Ganguly has taken over as the BCCI's 39th president. He is without a doubt the most famous of all names to take position.

The 47-year-old is now in charge of the world's richest cricket board.

AFP

He contested unopposed and now his tenure officially begins.

It's official - @SGanguly99 formally elected as the President of BCCI pic.twitter.com/Ln1VkCTyIW — BCCI (@BCCI) October 23, 2019

His appointment was finalised a week back.

Mood when you realise our beloved Dada begins a new journey today as the President of BCCI 💪🏻🤩

Good luck, @SGanguly99! 🙌🏻#BCCIPresident #ThisIsNewDelhi #DelhiCapitals pic.twitter.com/MjOUAAiZDH — Delhi Capitals (@DelhiCapitals) October 23, 2019

AFP

Don't Miss 106 SHARES 189 SHARES 4.7 K SHARES 136 SHARES

Needless to say, fans were overjoyed at the thought of Dada being BCCI president. Here;s what they had to say:

Historical day for all of us. Fellimg so proud as bangalyees 😍😍🙏🙏. @SGanguly99 💪💪🙏🙏. — SAMRAT MUKHERJEE (@prince3091) October 23, 2019

Congratulations Dada @SGanguly99 Sir 😍😘 — Pankaj Wadewale (@wadewale_pankaj) October 23, 2019

Congrats Dada✌ — Swatitripathi (@S374002) October 23, 2019

Many Congratulations!!! I think Indian cricket reach more higher than now. — akm shahabuddin (@shaheenbdb) October 23, 2019

Effectively president of world cricket, the BCCI run cricket! — Justine Robilliard (@FishChips1) October 23, 2019

Ganguly led India between 2000 and 2005. His Test debut came in style with a brilliant century at Lord's in 1996. Having represented India in over 400 international games, Ganguly was one the best players in the world in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

This is a new innings for him and no doubt he will lead from the front, just like he did as skipper.

With Inputs From PTI.
